headline: Black Bottom Cupcakes
description: These black bottom cupcakes are a decadent combination of fudgy chocolate cake and gooey cream cheese chocolate chip filling ‚Äî a chocoholic's dream!
name: Black Bottom Cupcakes

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease two 12-cup muffin tins or line with paper cups.
Beat cream cheese, egg, 1/3 cup sugar, and 1/8 teaspoon salt in a medium bowl until light and fluffy. Stir in chocolate chips; set aside.
Mix together flour, 1 cup sugar, cocoa, baking soda, and 1/2 teaspoon salt in a large bowl. Make a well in the center; add water, oil, vinegar, and vanilla. Stir together until well blended.
Fill the prepared muffin tins about 1/3 full with chocolate batter. Top each with a dollop of cream cheese mixture.
Bake in the preheated oven until a toothpick inserted into the chocolate cake comes out clean and the cream cheese center is set, 25 to 30 minutes.

review.reviewBody: must have done some thing wrong. cream cheese mixture did not stay on top. sank to bottom and bottom was not cooked and mixed with cake mix.

My husband described these cupcakes as a favorite from his childhood, and I've been looking for a good recipe. This one is so simple, I had almost all the ingredients on hand, and it's amazing how much they rise and yet how rich and delicious and moist they are. Thank you so much!

This recipe has been a staple at my house for so long. It is a great recipe and I always go back to it year after year for my daughter‚Äôs birthday parties. I double the recipe and make around 48 cupcakes at once and everyone loves them. Today my daughter, who‚Äôs already 14, will make them herself for the first time :)
Did not add vinegar
üå∑üå∑ I love this recipe, it's Wacky cake with cream cheese & chocolate chips, what's not to love?? I bake them one at a time, for maximum softness. Yum!! üå∑üå∑

Just nope. This recipe creates cupcakes that are mushy and fall apart at the same time. Yes, I tried it more than once. I know how to read and follow instructions exactly. I don‚Äôt understand the positive reviews of this. I‚Äôll find a different recipe elsewhere.
It‚Äôs very good but double the cheese cake
I actually made this recipe just how it‚Äôs written. Pile on that cream cheese on top, and I filled my muffin tins full. Baked for about 27 minutes. They were so perfect! Absolutely great recipe.

I've made this recipe about 5 times, it's great. Brings me back to one of my moms recipes. Happy times. 

I did this with my daughter.
This is an amazing recipe you don't need anything added just follow the instructions and enjoy them

Love these i have made hundreds of them. A few things i have learned and change. I do not add salt its no good for you and there is enough sodium with baking soda. I also had 1/3 cup special dark hersheys cocoa makes it rich my husband is a chocolate lover. Batter should be on thicker side. And filling needs to be just right i let cream cheese set out for 2 hrs before mixing. Mix cream cheese, egg and sugar until smooth then i just fold about a half a bag of mini chips in. Also filling should be thick not runny.
Followed recipe exactly. Cream cheese filling was too runny and there was too much of it. Made 24 standard size muffins, baked at lowest suggested time and they came out super brown and overdone.
Amazing! I used coffee instead of water and it turned out really good. Would 100 percent make again!

Made these for the first time today, and they turned out wonderfully! I followed the recipe exactly, except I used white vinegar instead of cider vinegar. I had a little bit of the cream cheese filling leftover, but was a bit short on the chocolate part. Next time I may make a little more of the chocolate. But ‚Äúas is‚Äù the recipe yielded 22 cupcakes. Very good and pretty!

This is my second time trying to make these. My aunt used to make them all the time and they were delicious. Now when I make them I follow this recipe to the T and they look awful. The cream cheese mixture is runny with a like chunk curds of cream cheese. This happened both times I‚Äôve tried this recipe. Any tips would be appreciated. I live in high altitudes and that is all I can think of why mine never turn out.
These cupcakes were very popular with the extended family. I like the idea that you can freeze them. My wife and I can pull them out of the freezer when needed as well.
Did what the one person said about using the two size cookie scoops. Great idea

These cupcakes are amazing! I put a little of the cake batter on top of the cream cheese filling, so the filling is more in the middle. Otherwise I don‚Äôt mess with perfection. They‚Äôre so good they don‚Äôt need frosting.

It‚Äôs been YEARS since I had a black bottom cupcake and I had a craving and was surprised to discover the internet doesn‚Äôt have too many recipes for them. Decided to give this recipe a shot. Made my first batch as written and giving them three stars. Second batch I used coffee instead of water, added espresso powder, a whole tablespoon of vanilla, used dark cocoa, doubled the salt in both the batter and filling (salt adds flavor to baked goods, not saltiness, it DOES matter and you CAN taste a difference, contrary to other reviews), and nearly doubled the chocolate chips. Baked in mini muffin tins for 12 minutes. Spray the cupcake liners if you want to make sure these won‚Äôt stick. 1/3 full was not enough for mini cupcakes. Fill halfway with batter and add a heaping teaspoon of filling. Next time I‚Äôd add a little dollop of raspberry jam before adding cream cheese filling to make them more like the ones from my childhood. I think these are much better cold from the refrigerator the day after they are baked.
Easy to make and super good
-will make these again!
Made these for a company pot luck. They were a high hit.

I have made this cupcakes for 45 years. A friend made them and brought them into work. She gave me recipe. My husband loved them. I love them too, they are pretty low in carbs. So if you are counting carbs they work well and fit into your low carb diet. It you love dark chocolate you will love them too. They freeze well. Enjoy!!! CFC
I didn't add the salt and used regular sized chocolate chips. They turned out perfectly and even my picky kids loved them!

These are beyond fantastic, Cupcake heaven! And I don't even like cake. I'm a pie person to be honest. The first time I made these, they were a gift for my boyfriend. We had only been dating for about three weeks at that time. I don't remember how many I made but they filled a gallon size zip-loc bag full. I gave them to my honey in the morning and they were gone by bed time. These did the trick!! I'm making them today and giving them to my honey in celebration of our 11th anniversary. I have made them several times, like when I want something, made a mistake, or just want to see him smile. They work every time. I have never changed a thing in this recipe. Make as directed and you will see.
Made this a while back. Sunk in a little bit still good. Will be trying again

I used to make this recipe when it was in the Best of Bridge cookbooks....remember those? It‚Äôs fabulous. Works every time. But I always have the same complaint.....I have to make more of the chocolate than the recipe calls for (1/2 again) because there is no way Im getting 24 cupcakes from this recipe. I like them decent sized...rising to above the paper.
I made them the way the recipe says, and they loved them. I said loved because they didn't last long. I also made them for my niece birthday. She loved it. No changes to the recipe. Delicious.
they are amazing!!

The cream cheese filling was great but the vinegar made the cupcakes taste strange. Also, there was so much cream cheese 
filling after the batter was gone. I will look for another recipe next time I make these.
The second time I made these, I cut back on the oil in the batter and doubled the amount of cream cheese to make a thicker blend. The richer cream cheese filling totally made these amazing.
Super delicious and an excellent offering for any dessert auction!
I made it twice and love it! And everyone else has. Now I'm made them again for Easter treats miniature size. Fabulous
delicious! iadded some choc chips on top when still hot and spread as icing, yummmm
Good recipe but definitely does NOT make 24 cupcakes! I got 16 nice sized, 18 smaller. Easy to make :)
I hope to make it again.
These were pure dark chocolate decadence!, Also easy to make!

This recipe is wrong! Don't make the same mistake I did. This recipe uses the original ratios for the filling but halves the ratios for the cake batter so you end up with twice as much filling as you need. The cream cheese filling runs all over the top instead of setting up in the middle. They were not right at all. Do yourself a favor and use the Hershey's website recipe from the '70's when they were called "Filled Rich Chocolate Cupcakes". Hope this helps!

I had to make the cream cheese mixture twice when I did it like the directions say my filling wasn‚Äôt fluffy. I still used the first batch and they taste great but when I did the second filling I did it a little different and got it fluffy. I‚Äôve never been much of a baker but my mom wanted me to make these for her. No one in our family has made them since my grandmother I‚Äôm so glad they turned out just right. Overall very easy to make!

My Grammy used to make these years ago and the recipe was gone when she passed... Tried several other variations until I found this one, and it's spot on! Wouldn't change a thing, except to experiment and try to make it gluten free for my boyfriend who has Celiac disease.
I didn't make any changes to the recipe. My family did not like these and I ended up throwing them out.
kids loved it.

I doubled the recipe because I couldn't see anywhere on the recipe how many cupcakes it made. Doubling the recipe made exactly 36 normal size cupcakes. They turned out perfect. I followed the recipe exactly. I would suggest not using your largest sized eggs. I chose the 2 smallest in the carton of large eggs. Baked 21 minutes.
I used a half cup of sour cream instead of the oil and the vinegar and they turned out great and moist
So easy to make and yummy!!
Served these at my daughters 16th...they were a huge hit. I baked the day before and kept them cold in the fridge, they were delicious!
Yummy! I made them in a round cake pan with the cream cheese on top and swirled a bit. Came out cake-like but good!
These were very yummy. I changed the 1 cup water to 1/2 cup coffee, 1/2 cup water. I also used a lot less chocolate chips.

Omg my family loooved these. I‚Äôm more of a cook and not a baker but these were easy and came out so springy and moist. I did use paper liners. The chocolate chips were still crunchy and the cream cheese batter keeps the chocolate from being too overpowering. Saving this one!
great

When the chocolate cake is married to the cream cheese top, it is to die for. However, the cake alone is too dense and pretty tasteless. I doubled my recipe because I was bringing the cupcakes to a party and I wanted to make sure I had some at home.The cupcakes were a success at the party. 

I made the chocolate cake from scratch instead of using store bought cake mix. I want to experiment with the chocolate cake mix to try and give it some more flavor and make it lighter instead of dense. 

Any ideas I should try?
I did not make any changes. They were great!!
I made this this weekend and they turned out great! I didn't check the serving size and made 12 huge cupcakes instead of 24 smaller ones, but they still cooked well. I'll definitely make these again

A delicious and pretty addition to a cookie tray but baker beware! Some experimenting is necessary when baking. Overfilling the baking cup even the slightest bit will cause the dark cake batter to bake too high--out of the liner. I used mini cupcake liners and put 1/2 Tablespoon of dark batter with 1 teaspoon of cream cheese batter. Baked 15 minutes. 
I would advise only filling the liner 1/3 full no matter the size. I might try using brownie batter next time, which doesn't rise so high.
I tired to make this recipe for mini cup cakes- it tasted good but didn't work as well as the pics for a mini cake- the filling sort of stayed on the top intstead of sinking into the middle.
Not as good as I hoped.
Easy recipe and really yummy! Used this recipe my first time making black bottoms and was very pleased! This recipe is a keeper!
I thought these would be so rich that I wouldn't like them, but they are perfect! I used hot chocolate instead of water and special dark cocoa powder.
A wonderful recipe.
I did not make any changes. Came out too dense and the cream cheese center did not work. Went all over the cupcake.
These were wonderful. Saving this one for the next carry in.
My cupcakes exploded and were burnt and raw with only 10 min left.
I made this exactly as the directions say, and all of my cream cheese mixture sank to the bottom of the cupcake. Probably will not make again.

These were so great. I had never had a black bottom cupcake, but love the idea of combining cupcakes and cheesecakes. I followed the recipe exactly and they turned out fantastic. I made these 2 days ahead of our cook out and I think the extra time made them taste even better. They are also particularly tasty if kept in the fridge and eaten cold. Will be adding this to my recipe box.

I've made these a few times now and I don't make any substitutions. They're perfect, loads of flavour and really gooey! These are best eaten on the day they're made, otherwise the gooey-ness goes lol!
Made it exactly as described and it is quick and easy with a great result.
Used a small bit more flour because the dough looked too liquid.
Very simple and delicious recipe. My family and I scarffed them down!

I've made this recipe many times and the raves I get continue for days. I've also made just the cake base, without the cream cheese filling. When I make the cake portion, I lightly dust it with confectioners sugar and serve it with a generous scoop of premium vanilla ice cream. The richness of the chocolate cake and the creaminess of the vanilla ice cream result in so many requests for the recipe that I have to explain how I came up with it. Because this cake is so moist, I've never frosted it (it diminishes the cake and the whole effect is lost!). Give it a try!

PS: I place the cake batter in an 8" x 8" x 2" pan. I've also doubled the recipe and made a 9" x 13" x 2" pan.
Too sweet!

I added some instant coffee granules to 1/2 c. hot water, added 1/2 c. milk to make the 1 c. liquid. Added 1/2 tsp. coconut extract to the cream cheese mixture. I got 16 cupcakes out of the recipe, baked for only 18 minutes. The extra cream cheese mix went into a ramekin and baked. I saved some mini chocolate chips and pushed them into the center of each cupcake after they came out of the oven, which melted and was so VERY yummy.

These are amazing! Taste just as good as my Nana's! I follow the recipe exactly the way it is, and perfect each time. I do recommend taking them out right away and placing them in an air tight container. Mine stay so moist.

These were great! I made it exactly according to the recipe, which I think everyone should do the first time they try a recipe! I got about 16 cupcakes. Next time I think I will substitute milk for the water. Oddly the cream cheese inside was a little undercooked while the cake part turned out perfect.
They turned out great, I added chocolate buttercream and everyone loved em'! 10 out of 10 do it again!

I would definitely make these again. They were so good! I bought cream cheese icing just in case but I enjoyed them without any icing. I had to cook mine for about 10 minutes longer. This recipe made me 18 cupcakes.

These are delicious , will make again and again . Especially my daughter loves these! Unlike others, I had no issues with the cream cheese being runny. If you follow the exact recipe, you should be fine! Thank you for posting the recipe.

These are unbelievably good! I did not change a thing...except I did not have choco chips which I substituted with chopped up chocolate bar. Delicious!! They're so rich that you should ideally make these mini-cupcake-sized. Delectable!!
They turned out like over done brownies. Couldn't even taste the cream cheese.
I added Kaluah instead of water. I ended up with sunken burnt cupcakes with an amazing filling.
I have made these several times and they are definitely a crowd pleaser! I used a favorite chocolate cake recipe but the filling is awesome!

I have made this recipe many times. It's easy to follow and turns out every time. I substitute 2/3 of the oil called for with apple sauce, which makes them more moist and light. Agree with another reviewer that the cream cheese has to be soft. I leave it sitting on top of my stove while pre-heating for several minutes and that does the trick. If you prefer a less-sweet taste, you can get away with less sugar in the filling and batter and they are still delicious.
I made it today, and man, are they good! I doubled the batch, and tweaked ever it ever so much...split a vanilla pod and added 2 t. Instant coffee. :)
I used Devil's food cake mix and it came out very good...

My mother used to make these and I finally made them myself for the first time tonight. The only thing I did differently was omit the 1/8 teaspoon of salt for the filling. My cupcakes were cooked in 20 minutes, and they came out looking and tasting pretty awesome.

Finally a blackbottom cupcake that turns out wonderful!!! Be careful not to over mix the cream cheese mixture, I sort of blended it with a spatula and it came out nice and fluffy instead of separated with a previous recipe. They look beautiful!

My husband requested cupcakes and I had all of the ingredients for this recipe so I gave it a whirl. He loved them, so I'll be making them again. I substituted 1/2 of the water for a blend of milk and coffee in the batter. Coffee always compliments chocolate flavor. I was forced to used regular sized chocolate chips, didn't have the mini ones, but they turned out great. In fact, I liked the larger burst of chocolate in the filling. Reduced the recipe serving size to "18" and got a perfect 12 cupcakes...I like to fill my muffin pans enough to get a healthy sized cupcake.

super easy to make and I think it genuinely taste fantastic just the way the recipe is written! Highly recommend this even to people who can't bake that is how easy and yummy this recipe is! Thank you so much for posting this.

I really love these. So moist, rich, and super easy. Here's a great tip; I used a large cookie scoop to transfer the batter to the cupcake liners and it came out to exactly 24, evenly filled cupcakes. Then I used a small cookie scoop to top the batter with the cream cheese mixture right in the center. They came out perfectly and the cream cheese mixture sunk into the batter as intended. Happy baking!
My kids find these so fascinating!

These are really good. The most important thing I have learned is that you should COOK THEM THE DAY BEFORE you eat them. For some strange reason, they taste 10X better the next day.
I make them in cupcake and regular layer circle cake.
I also only bake them for 25 min....seems to be fine.
Fine, but not as chocolatey as I was expecting.

I wouldn't eat these again warm. The melted chocolate was overpowering and I wasn't fond of the hot cream cheese either. After a night in the fridge they were pretty good, though. The reformed chocolate was much better tasting. I had used coffee instead of water as suggested and the flavor of dark chocolate really builds up the more you eat.
Yum! Used the dark chocolate coco powder!

My recipe made 24. I had cream cheese mixture left over. I did go back and add more to each cupcake, but still had a lot left over. I wouldn't recommend overdoing it on the cream cheese. Next time, I would make more cake mixture, maybe 1/2 batch. I'm not understanding the "blah" reviews about the cake, mine was moist, chocolatey and very tasty. I will try the coffee substitute next time as I normally do this but I was pretty surprised how good this recipe is as written. I baked mine for 25 minutes. I will make these again!
i've tried this and substitute coffee instead of water and it turned out soo goood.
The cream cheese part was pretty good, but the chocolate cake was lacking both in flavor and texture. Dry, bland cake.

Delicious and easy recipe! I added vanilla to the filling and a teaspoon instant coffee to the water. Mine were done in 15 minutes instead of 25 minutes. These were delicious and so moist. Will definitely make again.
I've made these at least 20 times now. Always perfect, everyone always devours them. Don't over cook. Delicious!!

This recipe is mmmm mmmmm good!! The only changes I made was to add half a teaspoon of vanilla to the filling and a spoon of instant coffee to the water. 20 minutes they were done. I also got 15 cupcakes out of this recipe, but then I like mine tall.
